) has daily connections to Bogotá with Aires, Satena and Avianca.

The town hosts the San Pedro folklore festival each year around late June and early July.

When not enjoying the parades in June, you can visit Huila Afrika Salvaje which is a nice park with many wild animal for you to enjoy.

There is Playa Juncal and El Juncal.
This city has made famous by the Tamales and Asado Huilense
and the different kind of bread or Biscochos, the most preferred is the Biscocho de Achira.
Neiva is situated in the zone of influence of guerrilla movements like FARC-EP. In 2011 the city has been hit by a number of bomb attacks,
which authorities attribute to urban militias of the FARC and other armed groups active in the city. The U.S. and Australian State Departments advises against all

travel to Neiva and the Huila department at large.

+As of June/2014, this no longer appears to be the case. As always, research the current situation ahead of time.
